title: How do I find out if I have a judgement against me from creditors?
question: I've already had 1 default judgement on me from a collection agency, which I've settled already, but was afraid that I might be getting more from different creditors, without even being notified (this has happened before - creditor filing summon behind my back). So I wanted to find out through LA Superior Court but I can't seem to find a working number to call and ask or find the info on their website (without getting charged). How and where can I look to see if I have any judgement or court summon against me? (credit report doesn't show even the 1 I had
answers: Pull your credit report, you may have to look at all of them. www.annualcredit.com and you can also open an account with creditkarma.com to keep tract of what is being reported.
You can go to the courthouse. The computer at the courthouse allows you to search by party name. Input your name and see what appears.
You can use the case search function on the LA County Superior Court website. There you can search for any case against you by entering your name...there may be a couple dollar fee, but not much.

you can look at your credit report at www.annualcreditreport.com or you can go to the local clerk for the courts and search the county database. If there are judgments in other jurisdictions you would have to look there as well.
